page.title: 12A FARM-HOUSE NEAR GLYNDE
page.content: Newhouse Farm is part of several other farms outside the area. The farmer's father bought it in 1911 and he was born there. The front of the house is Georgian. The back is older and a newer part was built onto it not long ago. The 6 year old girl showed us her skewbald pony and 2 orphan lambs. They have 2 dogs and some doves. The main interest of this farm is milking. We were shown the milking parlour where the cows are fed as they are milked. We drank some cold fresh milk from a large metal container. Lastly we were shown the combine harvester. It looked bigger in a barn than it does working in the fields.
